comments:
I've been running successfully with 3.01 for months. I had a memory card upgrade
and could not restart eclipse. I tried starting as eclipse -clean with no luck.
The following is the exception received:

!SESSION Tue Feb 08 08:24:49 EST 2005 ------------------------------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 Feb 08, 2005 08:24:49.531
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.lang.RuntimeException: Could not find framework
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.getBootPath(Main.java:395)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:174)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:704)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:688)

I have found some anecdotal references to the above error but nothing that
relates to merely having added memory to the machine and nothing that provided
me with a viable solution. I am adding this entry to bugzilla to accomplish
three goals; 1) find out what caused this, 2) find out how to fix this, and 3)
serve as a anchor point for anyone else that has this problem as a follow-up.
Existing 'solutions' such as "oh, we found it, bad zip file" or the like, or
"uninstall/reinstall are not really good solutions. 

I did resolve the problem by renaming the old directory path (equivalent to
deleting the old install) and reinstalling the product. I also saved off the
project workspaces and moved them back once I reinstalled. 

So if you guys could follow-up with what configuration file needs to be deleted
or otherwise modified that would be good. If you guys could fix eclipse startup
such that a change in machine configuration wouldn't terminate a startup, that
would be better. 

Thanks!

That's a desired feature of eclipse :-)
More seriously, are you sure that nothing got moved / corrupted / deleted on
your HD?
I only think of one thing:
- the osgi plugin got deleted (or some of its content)

The old eclipse plugin structure does have org.eclipse.osgi_3.0.1 as does the
new eclipse plugin. Really, the only thing that had changed was the addition of
512meg of memory. Gone are the days of running in 640k ( as Chris Matthews would
say HAAAAA!). Seriously, what did occur to me as something different are the
other plugins that worked (or atleast did not interfere) the day before. I am
one-for-one moving them to the new environment. As far as I can tell, the only
plugins I was running were:

com.sysdeo.eclipse.tomcat_3.0.0 - moved back, no affect.
org.eclipse.emf family
com.objectlearn family - I believe this is for lomboz as I recall.

I am 100% confident nothing destructive occurred by way of missing or damaged
files. I was happily stylin with Eclipse 3.x one moment, went to a gig of memory
the next moment, and could not start eclipse since. 

Can you tell from where the startup failed if it was loading eclipse or loading
something else, like the plugins? BTW, this happened before the splash screen
appeared if that helps.

Iam having the same issue.  I am running on Windows 2000.  I downloaded Eclipse 
and I am trying to run it.  While it is opening.  I receive an error.  This is 
what is in the log.

!SESSION Tue Mar 22 21:01:28 EST 2005 ------------------------------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 Mar 22, 2005 21:01:28.424
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.lang.RuntimeException: Could not find framework
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.getBootPath(Main.java:395)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:174)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:704)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:688)

Basically this failure means it cannot find the OSGi framework. The failure
happens very early on - absolutely no plugins are loaded at this point. 
Basically, it looks for a sub-directory of the install location called
plugins/org.eclipse.osgi_*, and if it doesn't find such a directory, it prints
this error message.  If you run with the "-debug" command line argument and
provide us with the resulting output, we might be able to find out what is going
on. Here is the command line to use (from the "eclipse" install directory):

java.exe -jar startup.jar -debug
We have never been able to reproduce this.

This is most often caused by unzipping Eclipse without specifying that the ZIP directory sutrcture should be maintained. Apparently, some ZIP tools (WinZip) don't make this the default option and a lot of people end up unzipping the entire structure to a single directory.
When Eclipse is unzipped, it should have an entire tree of subdirectories such as plugins, features, etc.

I get a very similar error when trying to start Eclipse.

Recently, I tried to install Eclipse-SDK-3.1.1-win32 to a Windows XP Pro system I had access to. The directory structure seemed to be intact. There was a plugin directory, though it lacked the org.eclipse.osgi_* directory. 

-debug gave:
C:\PROGRAM\ECLIPSE>java.exe -jar startup.jar -debug
Install location:
    file:/c:/Program/eclipse/
Configuration file:
    file:/c:/Program/eclipse/configuration/config.ini loaded
Configuration location:
    file:/c:/Program/eclipse/configuration/

Running the eclipse.exe gave an error, stating that an error had been printed to configuration/1137960335437, which said:
!SESSION Sun Jan 22 21:05:35 CET 2006 ------------------------------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 2006-01-22 21:05:35.484
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.lang.RuntimeException: Could not find framework
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.getBootPath(Main.java:635)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:272)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:973)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:948)

I recieved the same error on MacOSX, after reading through this thread I noticed that I had overwritten my plugin and features directory when copying in a plugin.  

I reinstalled eclipse and carfully copied over the plugin I wanted to install, making sure this time that I choose not to destructivly overwrite the directory contents and eclipse is now showing me love.

Hopefully this is also the case with windows users.
